Name: Imperial Settlers: Marketplace
Description:
Four Imperial Settlers tiles, that give you additional options and actions!

Printed on high quality cardboard, those four tiles include a marketplace, which your faction can access and discover a new action available for your Empire!

—description from the publisher

Name: Homebrew: The Potion Brewing Game
Description:
In Homebrew: The Potion Brewing Game, the players venture down into the haunted basement of their house. The players are attempting to brew magic potions and need to find the correct ingredients, but someone has left the basement in a terrible mess!

In every room of the basement, one of six different magic ingredients is to be found. The players each hold secret recipe cards and take turns exploring the basement by placing new rooms next to the existing ones.

When a player manages to find the ingredients required to brew their special magic potion, they gain a point. The player having brewed the most potions when the basement is fully explored becomes the potion master and wins the game!

—description from the designer

Name: BodoCa
Description:
User summary
BodoCa is short for 'Board Game's Card Game'. It is a Japanese card game with only Japanese text on the cards, so is very language dependent as is.

BodoCa is a party trivia card game about board games. The cards contain board game attributes such as theme, component, or designer. There are two play styles: expert and family.

For the family game, the game flow is similar to 20 questions. Each player, except the leader, has a hand of ten cards. The leader thinks of a game, then the players use their cards to narrow down the title. The person who guesses correctly wins the round.

For the expert game style, players are dealt a hand of cards, then each play one card. Players then try to come up with games that fit the criteria described by the cards in play.

Name: Sfacteria, 425 a.C.
Description:
This is a game that simulates the battles of Pilo and Sfacteria during the Peloponnesian War.

It is a new edition of  SphactÃ©rie 425 av. J.-C. published in Vae Victis 95.

Name: Egemonia
Description:
"Egemonia" simulates the Peloponnesian War between Sparta and Athens in ancient Greece. Each player represent one of these two important cities and will try to orientate as much areas as possible to its side. 
The focus is on influence rather than on real wargaming.

Name: Vertical
Description: In Vertical, you play a mountaineer on an evolving, demanding cliff face, competing against ruthless competitors to climb, which will be a problem since you've forgotten some of your equipment...

Name: Car Clash
Description: Clash with your opponents on a trail full of pitfalls. In Car Clash, you build your track, construct your vehicle, and face your opponents throughout a thrilling race.

Name: Metro
Description: The Parisian metro is a true labyrinth. In Metro, you must assemble your metro line and be the first to reach your destination, taking as few connections as possible.

Name: 勇者アーキテクト 2B (Brave Architect 2B)
勇者アーキテクト 2R (Brave Architect 2R)
No Escape: Salvation
Description:
Are you ready to take No Escape to the next level? The get ready for Salvation!
Avoid ALIENS attempting to capture, and most likely probe you.
Save other SURVIVORS, or just steal their stuff.
You can even play COOP to try to save the station together....or not.

It's YOUR game, customize it the way you want with the new Salvation expansion.

This expansion adds Alien rules with 8 alien meeples, 6 action tiles and 6 maze tiles. Survivor Rules with 20 survivor tokens, 8 maze tiles and 6 action tiles. And Coop Rules with 8 Mission tokens, 2 maze tiles and 6 action tiles.

-description from designer

Name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Brandy Station
Description:
In June of 1863 Alfred Pleasonton and the cavalry of the Army of the Potomac would face J.E.B. Stuart's cavalry of the Army of Northern Virginia near Culpepper Virginia in what would be the largest cavalry battle in North America.

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game system of battles of the American Civil War.  Brandy Station is the seventh game in the series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to its size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 272 2-sided counters.

The Battle Book includes two Scenarios; Groveton, August 28th: The Full Battle and Longstreet Arrives, August 29th and an initial strength chart.

The map measures 39" x 35" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.
AND just added (July 25, 2018), a 21" x 35" map extension to the west with a new Order of Arrival card to accommodate the new map.
A new ZunTzu box also incorporates the new map extension.

The full game is available for download at: http://UhlanGames.us
as are Zun Tzu gameboxes for all LFM games
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: ひどらのしょうもうせん (Hydra's War of Attrition)
Description:
ã²ã©ã‚‰ã®ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‚‚ã†ã›ã‚“ (Hitora no Shousen) Hydra's War of Attrition is a Japanese 2 player abstract game with a horror theme.

Translated from the rules
"There are small hydras which inhabit a dangerous land full of evil spirits. They sluggishly move back and forth, sometimes running across one another. When that happens, they battle to the death."

User description
Each player places a trio of hydra tokens (Majoritei, Arakure, and Fushigi) on marked spaces along the edge of the board.  A turn then consists of the following steps: Multiplying the Majoritei, moving a hydra, and possibly removing opposing hydra pieces.

Players start by taking a Majoritei hydra from their supply and placing it next to another one already on the board. They then choose one of their hydra to move. Finally, if they've surrounded an opponent's hydra and at least one of their surrounding hyrda is on a nest of evil spirits, they capture their opponent's piece and return their piece from the nest to their supply.

These steps are repeated until one player can either form a line using six of their hydra, or until all of a player's hydra are captured.

Name: Minuteman
Description:
Company level American Revolution wargame rules.

A5 Booklet of 51 pages, plus the 4-page Card Playsheets in the centre of the booklet.

These rules carry on from 'Ranger', used for the French-Indian Wars and have similar sections to 'File Leader', again by Pete Berry. Players who have played either of these two games will be familiar with the rules system.

Standard D6 used throughout.

Name: Race To Space
Description: In Race to Space, players embark on an epic battle of wits earning points and game advantages by completing mission quests. Avoid treacherous sabotages, swaps, steals and other shenanigans while navigating through mini games such as Rock-Paper-Scissors duels, instant win chances, and dice challenges. Blast off with this Space Age game designed to re-define learning as an out of this world experience! Finally, a game for kids who wish learning was fun!

Name: Orbit Battle
Description:
You are a squad commander in charge of eight spaceships and five battle rings. A meteor has destroyed your planet, and you are searching for a new home. You are now in a race to capture two of the three remaining big planets to rule the galaxy. But beware you have an enemy with the same mission.

To win this intergalactic Orbit Battle, you need to use all your skill to outmaneuver your enemy and capture the planets.

The object of the game is to be the first player to capture two of the three big planets with three spaceships on each of the big planets. The first player who has invaded a big planet with three spaceships has captured that planet. When a player has invaded the big planet with three spaceships, the other player cannot enter this planet anymore.

Name: Ojczysty
Description:
Ojczysty ("Native") is a party game in which Polish language will surprise you with its wealth. More than hundred unusual words. Their meanings are explained on the cards. One of the six words on the board will be your hidden goal. Your task is to guess it with the help of clue cards provided by another player. Will you risk betting only one answer...?
 
The game was published as part of the social and educational campaign "Native - add to favorites", run by the National Center for Culture since 2012. Its aim is to shape the linguistic awareness of Poles and to promote care for the correctness of the Polish language.

—description from the designer

Name: Pestka, drops, cukierek
Description:
Pestka, drops, cukierek is a kid's journey to the world of economics. The game presents the basic mechanisms of demand and supply in an accessible way, and at the same time it tells an extraordinary story of a mysterious land hidden in Julek's pocket. The evil king forbids everything that gives joy, health and happiness! Your task is to make the magical land be vibrant again. But you must hurry - the evil king raises funds to pay for the army, which is to punish the rebel residents. The fate of the kingdom is in your hands!

The game was created on the basis of a book by one of the most valued Polish writers for children - Grzegorz Kasdepke.

Gameplay:
There are 7 action fields on the board. In your turn, you can move to any field in a clockwise direction (Players themselves choose how many squares they will move their pawn. But the consequence of this quick free access to various actions is the increasing frequency of paying tribute to the king.) On the action field, a player can perform the appropriate action: draw resources, change them into "goods" (for example a pencil into a picture), sell "goods" to inhabitants of gray houses or exchange resources. After each action, active player asks others if they want to pay him 1 coin to do the same action in a limited way.

The game may end in two ways: When the number of gray houses is smaller than the number of players - then the player with the most coins is the winner; When the royal treasury is full, then everybody lose.

—description from the designer

Name: DisgRace To The White House
Description:
DisgRace To The White House is a fast-paced, strategic, and satirical board game for energized progressives everywhere. In between protesting, marching, and crying into your pillow--why not laugh too? DisgRace To The White House provides catharsis and the roadmap to resistance during these trying, rights-depleted, tiny-hands times. Players brush up on America's horribly archaic Electoral College system as well as DJT's certifiably insane Tweets, as they navigate the election in a race to the White House.

While battling for electoral votes, players impersonate Trump's "unique" form of verbal diarrhea, quote mind-bending Tweets, and pick up "Disaster" Cards, all in the name of winning the oval office through alternative facts. Interactive, team-building and generally outrageous, players shriek, squeal, and laugh--all at the same time. Gameplay constantly shifts until a winner is crowned (poor choice of words). You're never assured of victory until the bitter end (sorry "Haters and Losers!"). A perfect gift--play it around the trashcan fire when the Trumpocalypse finally comes!

—description from the designers

Name: Zwoggel
Description:
Zwoggels are cute little creatures who live under stones, but nobody wants to encounter them three times. Why? Because then you have to take home one of the three, and whoever does this three times is eliminated — from the game, that is.

Gameplay in Zwoggel is simple: Flip two tiles face up, then place three new tiles face down and hope someone else falls into your trap. If you reveal three zwoggels of the same color in a row, then you have to take one home. Hope you can avoid finding more in the future...

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Knights of Casterly Rock
Description:
The Lannisters spare no expense when it comes to outfitting their troops. Even the regular line soldier has the finest in arms and armor. So, when it comes to a unit as special as their mounted knights, cost is never an issue. The Knights of Casterly Rock have literally the best equipment and training that money can buy. And they are worth every penny on the battlefield as they cut their way through enemy ranks.

The Lannister Knights of Casterly Rock Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game brings a fast, hard-hitting, and durable unit to the battlefield. Being cavalry, they get an extra movement at the start of their activation. They are also deadly on the Charge, with their weapons gaining Critical Blow and Sundering. Enemies will quickly become disheartened fighting them, being forced to make Panic Tests whenever the Knights survive a round of combat.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Heroes I
Description:
Wars are fought with money, and in the War of the Five Kings, none of the Great Houses are more financially equipped than the Lannisters. They outfit their troops in the best armor and arm them with the finest steel. But troops still need leaders.

Some show their strength on the battlefield, like the Hound, Tyrion, or Lord Tywin. For others, like Maester Pycelle and the High Sparrow, their power is felt in the political arena. But make no mistake, they can influence the outcome of a battle all the same. The Lannister Heroes set for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives players a powerful advantage in the war for the fate of Westeros.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Bowmen
Description:
In battle, the goal is to defeat your opponent without being defeated, yourself. If you can attack your enemy and they cannot retaliate, that goes a long way to victory. For House Stark, that means employing skilled bowmen in their ranks. They have trained relentlessly in their everyday lives as trappers, rangers, and hunters. Now, they form up and send out steel-tipped death to the foes of the Direwolf.

The Stark Bowmen Unit Box provides a long-range option for Stark commanders in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game. Though very lightly armored and not equipped for melee, they more than make up for it with their ability to put volley fire at enemies. They can even ignore line of sight requirements, arcing their arrows high into the air to strike at hidden targets.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Heroes I
Description:
One thing remains true for the unaligned forces in the War of the Five Kings, whether they’re fighting for coin, self-interest, or simple survival, they always remain true to themselves. They are a wild card that can be added to any army in the game.

Some Heroes, like Roose Bolton and Ramsay Snow, are most at home on the battlefield alongside their men. Others, such as Petyr Baelish and Lord Varys, like to manipulate the situation behind-the-scenes. The Neutral Heroes set for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game comes with everything a Commander needs to introduce some unknown elements into the war for the fate of Westeros.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bolton Flayed Men
Description:
House Bolton has the most-armored unit on the field of battle. The Flayed Men cavalry are clad in heavy plate armor and their horses are equally armored in thick barding. Only the toughest and largest horses can withstand the great weight put upon them by all that steel. While they might not be the fastest cavalry unit, they are certainly the hardiest. And their own war flails make enemy defenses seem pointless as the spiked balls wrap around limbs or curve over shields.

The Bolton Flayed Men Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game allows Commanders to field a rough and rugged cavalry unit in their forces. As a Neutral unit, The Flayed Men will work for any army willing to pay their price. They have some of the best Defense Saves in the game, letting them stay on the field, utilizing their nasty war flails on the enemy for quite some time.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bolton Bastard's Girls
Description:
Dogs have been used as part of the hunt for hundreds of years. Their keen sense of smell, swift running speed, and vicious bite have helped man put food on the table since their domestication. House Bolton, though, has trained dogs to not just hunt wild game, but men out on the field of battle. Accompanied by handlers, whose arrows help slow their prey, the dogs are quick to chew apart anyone they catch.

The Bolton Bastard’s Girls Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game allows Commanders to field this squad as part of their force. Being a Neutral unit, any house can hire them on. Lightly armored, these swift hunters can easily take down enemies with a combination of arrows and teeth.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Mechanisms
Description:
Mechanisms is a game of mechanisms.

To play, deal each player 3 Mechanism Cards and place the included hodgepodge of components within reach of everyone on a table. The first clue-giver is the person who most recently posted a comment on BoardGameGeek.

Starting with the first clue-giver, then clockwise, each clue-giver has 30 seconds to silently use the components on the table (as well as fellow players) as props to get someone to guess 2 of their Mechanism Cards. Clue-givers are encouraged to pair the mechanisms in a set of seemingly seamless actions as if they were playing a game with all mechanisms present. The guesser(s) gets the correctly guessed Mechanism Card as a point and the clue-giver gets the third Mechanism Card as a point if 2 mechanisms are guessed.

After everyone has had a turn, shuffle all non-point Mechanism cards and deal 2 new Mechanism cards to each player, continuing the game.

The player who collects 5 Mechanisms first this way, wins! As a finale, feel free to pitch a fun, creative, and unique game idea using all of your mechanism point cards!

—description from the designer

Name: Lunarbaboon's Parenting is Easy
Description:
Is being a parent easy? Are your feelings of anxiety trolling you? If only life had some uncomplicated way to explain everything, like it used to be when all we had to worry about was our ABC's.

Parenting is Easy is a casual board game for 2 to 4 players, meant for high strung adults, hyperactive kids, or anyone in between. Quick and easy to learn, everyone's goal is to drive their parents completely insane by causing as much chaos as possible in their family home.

Name: Magnio
Description:
Magnio consists of unique and mesmerizing pieces that push, pull and shoot on each other - with the power of magnetism. Similar to a deck of cards, you’re not limited to a single game. You'll find several fun and attractive games in the box, but you will soon find yourself experimenting and playing with the pieces freehand. Now you'll be able to create your very own games, expanding the possibility of Magnio even further!

Magnetic air-hockey? No problem!

Magnetic curling? Create it!

It's a game designed for those that desire to think outside the box, or just want to casually play some magnetic dexterity action!

You're invited to explore the possibilities with hands-on demonstrations of physics and fun. Push, pull, and shoot magnets with other magnets as you manipulate the set. Create structures and sculptures, test your skills, create new games, and find even more ways to play. However you decide to use them, we're positive you'll enjoy the experience of Magination.

Name: The Hunt for Lirog
Description:
In this little card game you are trying to capture magical creature named Lirog. This old and powerfull but not too smart being, has something priceless in his posession. As one of the wizards you are trying to lure him into the trap using spells and forest fruits. In the deck there are 12 kind of cards with distiguish powers. Every player is trying to program the game area, so that after activation, Lirog will enter their trap.

There are only 52 cards in the deck. At the start of the game players recive 3 random cards each. In a specified order they can  put one card on the game board and take 1 card from the market or take 2 cards from the market. After all players finished their turns, creature will make his moves. Depending on  cards that affect him, he will move  around the game board. If during move phase Lirog enters one of the traps, the game ends. Owner of that trap becomes the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: MiniCity
Description:
Minicity, the funnest game to learn English with friends. Explore this coloring and exciting city full of surprises!

It consists of a colorful and vibrant circular board where you can move from the launch of a dice. Players start at the Bank, then passing through different places and stores in the miniature city. They can buy all the places and adding workers and products related to every place or shop. And all in English!

Every time players stop at the social media icons, they receive “social media messages” through the messages cards and get ready for different surprises and actions to do at MiniCity. They can be lucky, or not so much!

Players can role play to “work” as a bank teller or a realtor while playing. Also, they can use Minicity cars and taxi, if getting some of the lucky messages.

The player with the most places and most money at the end of the game will be the winner.

Name: Food Chain Magnate: The Ketchup Mechanism & Other Ideas
Description:
"Chef! Some of our guests are asking for ketchup. Do we have any?" "We don't serve ketchup in this company." "Also they are asking whether the restaurant will expand anytime soon? There's a restaurant in the new quarter and with all the roadwork lately, it is getting a lot of traffic." "Can't you see I am working on my new masterpiece? How can I concentrate like this? I need that Michelin star! And this new sushi dish is just the thing. Or maybe if I combine kimchi with ice cream..." "But chef. Your guests are not asking for fancy stuff; they want ketchup and coffee. And better decorations. And a new menu." "Get out of my kitchen. Now!"

The Ketchup Mechanism & Other Ideas is an expansion for Food Chain Magnate.

Includes:

     a new set of milestones that completely changes strategic options
     coffee and barista's: places where people stop on the way to get food
     new districts with different types of buildings
     lobbyists that can place parks and new roads
     new types of food: kimchi, sushi & noodles
     new marketing types: mass marketeers, rural marketeers and gourmet food critics
     new employees: French fries; movie stars and working the night shift 
     hard choices
     materials to play with 6 players
     ketchup!

Name: Tower of Madness: Gen Con Promo Set
Description:
Four card promo set from Gen Con 2018 includes:

Dr. Jin Wu
Officer Brady
Casey Calleigh
Professor Culpepper

Name: Fugue
Description:
In Fugue, your mind has split and is at war with itself. You must leverage your imagination, vision, depth, passion, and spirit to dominate your opponents and wrestle back control of your mind.

By using tile sets and Fugues, you will move Mind tiles from one area of the mind to another, and into your Passion area where they are scored. But be warned, you are not the only force inside the mind.

Fugue is a deceptively simple tile placement game for 1-4 mental forces.

Live on Kickstarter!

Visit www.lostagegames.com for more info

—description from the publisher

Name: TV Triviapalooza
Description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball!  Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun.  Seriously.

—description from the box

Name: 80s Triviapalooza
Description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball!  Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun.  Seriously.

—description from the box

Name: Drinking Games for People Who Never Drink Except When They Do
Description:
A collection of 50 drinking games broken into six different categories: active, drinking, improv, team, word and stupid. Some games are old standards (but with a new twist), while others are little known. Whether it be a pregame, vision quest or full-blown mass cult suicide - there's a game here to suit every get-together!

From the creators of the game, "DRUNK STONED OR STUPID," games are customizable to play with or without drinking.

Name: Pop Music Triviapalooza
Description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!  Juicy little tidbits of useless knowledge!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball!  Play for hours and collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun.  Seriously.

—description from the box

Name: Christmas Questions Triviapalooza
Description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that'll have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!

Put on your smarty pants and have a ball!  Play for hours & collect 'em all!  Juicy little tidbits of useless knowledge!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun.  Seriously.

—description from the box

Name: Movies Triviapalooza
Description:
Don't let this little box fool you...it's stuffed with tons of interesting trivia questions that's have you thinking, laughing, and wracking your brains!  Juicy little tidbits of useless knowledge.

Put on your smarty pans and have a ball!  Play for hours & collect 'em all!

This cute little box contains a game board, 4 pawns, a die, 500 questions on cards, rules, and unquantifiable fun.  Seriously.

—description from the box

Name: Calico Critters Surprise Party Game
Description:
Help the Critters find all the hidden objects to decorate the house before the guest of honor arrives.  The 3-dimensional game board features 4 Calico Critter rooms.

As you travel the game board with your Critter, you'll look for the 5 things which belong in your room.  You'll need a good memory and a bit of luck to succeed.  If you get your room totally decorated first, before your opponents' AND before the birthday girl arrives--Surprise! You win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Glyph Chess: The 3rd Player Expansion Pack
Description:
Glyph is a tactic style board game for two to three players, adapted from a famous chinese comic book, Tales of Tarsylia. Each Character has its unique skill.  To win, players must maneuver their pieces to get their Scepter Piece to the center of the board or eliminate all enemy players’ Scepters.

—description from the publisher

The expansion pack includes eleven bronze pieces for a third player.

Name: Unmask!
Description:
Unmask! is a simple colorful, set collection, hidden role, press your luck game in which your goal is to collect the most victory points. You gain points by expanding your card collection through your "investigations".

Set in the Victorian Era, you take the role of one of the detectives whose job is to find the culprit behind a heist of the noble treasure by gathering information from the witnesses attending the grand event while the villain is lurking about trying to block all your efforts. In this small card game, you will be given the chance to unmask each other in order to nullify an opponent's special bonus through careful deduction before the game ends.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cridanimo
Description:
As each new card is turned up, be careful to observe the number of animals, because depending on whether it is odd or even, you’ll need to imitate a different animal call. Be careful you don’t end up having kittens!
—description from the publisher

À chaque carte retournée, attention de bien observer le nombre d’animaux car pair ou impair, l’animal à imiter ne sera pas le même… De quoi devenir complètement chèvre !
—description from the publisher (French)

Name: Savanimo
Description:
How can you keep from going crazy when you have to either catch the animal that's represented or the one that isn't??  A game of deduction and speed for the very young.
—description from the publisher

Comment ne pas perdre la tête quand il faut, soit attraper l'animal représenté, soit celui qui ne l'est pas ?  Un jeu de déduction et de rapidité pour les plus jeunes.
—description from the publisher (French)

Name: Yam's Junior
Description:
A new kids’ version of the famous game of Yahtzee, by Djeco: three rolls of the dice to get the best combination of animals in three-of-a-kind, families, four-of-a-kind, and, best of all, yahtzee – just like in the grown-ups’ game!
—description from the publisher

Le célèbre jeu du Yam revisité par Djeco pour le plus petits : sur les dés des animaux à regrouper en 3 lancers pour former des brelans, des familles, des carrés et surtout le yams comme les grands !
—description from the publisher (French)

Name: Batman Miniature Game: The Joker – Clowns Party
Description:
Don't make us laugh. The green hair. The crazed smile. The maniacal cackle. You know exactly who he is and how far he'd go to put a smile on your face.

Whether by way of award-winning films like "The Dark Knight," Emmy-winning animated programs like "Batman: The Animated Series," video game appearances such as the record-breaking "Batman: Arkham Asylum," or the countless comics stacking comic book shelves and digital libraries, the Joker stands unquestionably as the most recognizable and popular comic book villain in pop culture history. Unpredictable, violent and incredibly dangerous, he is chaos personified and has taken on everyone from his archenemy Batman to even the Man of Steel.

But Gotham remains his primary home and Batman his biggest adversary, and no hero is perhaps better suited as in many ways, the Joker is the polar opposite of the Dark Knight. Both were created by a great tragedy, but Batman has since vowed to do whatever it takes to prevent similar incidents, the Joker revels in creating chaos and destroying lives, believing that life’s a big joke and psychotically demonstrating that in a moment, it can all change.

Not much is known about his past, but his acts during the present are what define the Joker as one of the greatest threats to our heroes and the people they've sworn to protect. He's killed a Robin, crippled Batgirl, and tortured and murdered countless people throughout the DC Universe—all just for a laugh.

Bat-Boxes are the ultimate way to jump into the action of the Batman Miniature Game! Each box contains a complete Crew and all the cards you need to play. In addition, in each Bat Box you will find a unique Objective for your Crew and a brand new scenario. If you’re new to the Batman Miniature Game, you’ll find a set of Quickstart Rules in each box, so you can start playing right away!

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman Miniature Game: Suicide Squad
Description:
Superheroes aren't the answer to every problem. Sometimes, extreme situations require extreme measures…or extreme individuals. The sort of individuals who call the infamous Belle Reve Prison home—super-villains.

Of course, no one will officially admit to any of this. That's the charm of Task Force X, perhaps better known by its nickname: the Suicide Squad. This team of super-villains, assembled by their director Amanda “The Wall” Waller, undertakes high-risk covert operations and in exchange receive commuted prison sentences. And we do mean high-risk. Regardless of abilities and talent, every member of the Squad is expendable—it’s expected that many will not return. As expendable assets, all members are fitted with an explosive device in their neck to assure obedience. If Squad members try to escape while on a mission...well, escape isn't an option. Runaway and its BOOM!

Given the rigorous requirements of the job, the Suicide Squad lineup is always in flux. The roster has included Deadshot, a precise marksman and assassin; Harley Quinn, a peppy but psychotic villain; Captain Boomerang, the man who turns boomerangs into lethal weapons; Enchantress, a powerful sorceress who can wield magical energy; and their sometimes field leader Rick Flag, an elite soldier who is one of the only members who isn’t a super-villain.

A group of super-villains who have a license to take drastic action in the name of serving a mission? There's no way that could end badly.

Bat-Boxes are the ultimate way to jump into the action of the Batman Miniature Game! Each box contains a complete Crew and all the cards you need to play. In addition, in each Bat Box you will find a unique Objective for your Crew and a brand new scenario. If you’re new to the Batman Miniature Game, you’ll find a set of Quickstart Rules in each box, so you can start playing right away!

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman Miniature Game: The Riddler – Quizmasters
Description:
Riddle us this: what cerebral criminal with an affinity for purple and green loves challenging the Dark Knight with cleverly calculated crimes and puzzling plots?

One of the Dark Knight's most infamous villains, Edward Nygma enjoys flaunting his intellectual superiority by conducting crimes and leaving clues for Batman to piece together. While this habit constantly leads to the aptly named Riddler failing in his criminal endeavours, his puzzle-problem actually stems not only from his own narcissism and ego, but also from a deep-seeded psychological compulsion. Because of this, the Riddler often finds himself a resident of Arkham Asylum following his inevitable capture.

Possessing a genius-level intellect, the Riddler creates elaborate, sometimes Rube Goldberg-esque traps, and is even willing to use innocent civilians as bait. Although not physically imposing, the Riddler's brilliance, neurosis and lack of empathy make him an incredibly dangerous foe. He cares very little—if at all—about the lives of those he uses in his plots and instead only sees them as disposable pawns in his continuing intellectual battle against Batman.

Bat-Boxes are the ultimate way to jump into the action of the Batman Miniature Game! Each box contains a complete Crew and all the cards you need to play. In addition, in each Bat Box you will find a unique Objective for your Crew and a brand new scenario. If you’re new to the Batman Miniature Game, you’ll find a set of Quickstart Rules in each box, so you can start playing right away!

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman Miniature Game: Batman 80th Anniversary
Description:
Dark Knight. Caped Crusader. World’s Greatest Detective. Whatever you know him as, wherever you know him from—the blockbuster movies, TV shows, video games, cartoons, or millions of comics—Batman is proof you don’t need superpowers to be a superhero… and the poster boy for what a bad childhood can do to you.

Millionaire Bruce Wayne was just a kid when he watched his parents get gunned down during a mugging in Gotham City. The crime would define his life, as he dedicated himself to becoming the world’s greatest weapon against crime—the Batman.

Forget his Batarangs, Batmobile, or Utility Belt filled with high-tech weapons. Batman is the most feared superhero of all because he’s pushed himself to the absolute pinnacle of human achievement. He’s a brilliant detective who’s mastered fighting techniques the world’s barely heard of. An Olympic-caliber athlete with a plan for every occasion, Batman’s seemingly always five steps ahead of his foes. But in his crusade against injustice, two questions always loom: How far will he go to protect the innocent, and will he sacrifice his humanity along the way?

2019 will be the 80th birthday for the caped crusader since his first appearance in Detective Comics #27 from 1939. So what better way to celebrate than with a new version of Batman. The 80th Anniversary miniature sees the Dark Knight leaping into action, surrounded by a cloud of bats, to instil fear into the hearts of his foes.

Happy birthday, Bruce. Here’s to another Bat-Tastic 80 years!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ascension: Year Five Collector's Edition
Description:
Year Five Collector's Edition!

Use Insight to access the Dreamscape that contains powerful Heroes, Constructs and Visions. Then, take part in the War of Shadows to harness the power of Night and Day.

The Year Five Collector's Edition includes the base set of Ascension, Dreamscape and War of Shadows expansions, and all promo cards released throughout Ascension's fifth year.

All cards and game board are treated in premium foil, and this unique Collector's Edition comes with a special token pouch to hold 100 game tokens. The game is packed in a full-color tin but also comes with a travel box and dividers for portability and organization.

Name: Age of Towers: The Undead
Description:
The undead army of Lazarha, Queen of Shadows, have in turn taken roots in the mines of Mount Ilyria! Spearheaded by the Doomed Trooper, master of enslaved souls, the Dark Rampage is spreading over your territories and is quickly proving to be more dangerous than you thought: specters, skeletons, and zombies are coming for you!

This expansion requires the Age of Towers core box to play.

This expansion contains:

96 monster tokens (16 per player)
6 boss tokens (1 per player)
1 boss board
1 rulebook

Name: Age of Towers: The Dark Elves
Description:
An angry and ambitious chorus rises from the darkest subterranean depths… Your mines—already weakened by previous assaults—are now the target of an attack led by Matrone Malizia, Queen of the Dark Elves. Archers, assassins, and dark priests are rushing toward your city under the supervision of the Tremonas, the black queens.

This expansion contains:

60 monster tokens (10 per player)
6 boss tokens (1 per player)
1 boss board
5 cards per language
1 rulebook

Name: Age of Towers: Building Set
Description:
This expansion contains:


    1 Crystal Mine Mini and its quest card
    1 Stronghold Mini and its quest card
    1 Catapult Mini and its quest card
    1 Frisky Pig Mini and its quest card
    1 Traveling Market Mini its quest card
    4 Tower Ruins and their quest cards

Name: Going Further: Multiplayer edition
Description:
Hurray, your company just got a lucrative job: build a road between two cities.
But the computer managing the production line just went bananas and random building material comes out of the factory.

You already heard this story? Yes, but now it is multiplayer!

Going Further is a fast tile laying game for 1 to 4 players.

Each player build his own road by joining tiles picked from a common set called "Tile Factory". 
The tiles in the Tile Factory are visible to all players.  
Beware that not all the tiles in the Tile Factory are immediately available to be played. Some of them can be unlocked only after other tiles have been selected and connected to a road. So, be fast to get to that valuable tile faster than your opponents!

The game ends when no more playable tiles are available.

Each player shall choose the best strategy to unlock new tiles while scoring as many points as possible and, at the same time, preventing the opponents to do the same.. 
In fact, each tile grants a different number of points; the total score consists of the sum of each individual tile points.
Additional points can be added or removed from the total, depending on the achieved road final configuration.

In particular, watch out for road loops and famous landmarks!

—description from the publisher

Name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Core Rulebook
Description:
Welcome to the Multiverse!

Even in blackest day and darkest night, when all odds are stacked against them by super villains, interstellar invaders, crazed despots and maniacal anarchists, the world's finest heroes assemble to face the threat. Now, with the DC Universe Miniature Game, the stories of these epic battles between superhumans, gods and monsters is at Your fingertips...

In the DC Universe Miniature Game, You and Your friends collect a set of beautiful miniatures of your favourite DC heroes and villains, bring them to life by painting them, and then using them as playing pieces in an exciting multi-faceted, three dimensional tactical game. Every model in the DC Universe Miniature Games is supplied with a character card, which tracks a model's actions and health during a game. Most importantly, the character card keeps track of a model's Power Counters, which are used to fuel powers and abilities, from flight and teleportation, to heat vision and magical spells.

Picking models to battle in the DC Universe Miniature Game is really easy, and the game is designed to offer total flexibility in how You assemble Your teams. Firstly You need to decide if Your team is predominantly Heroes or Villains. You can choose any model of the same 'alignment' to join Your team. Some models have a Neutral alignment, which means the can join either team.

The game is scenario based, although You can play a simple deathmatch just for fun.

Sequence of Play

Each Round is broken down into four distinct phases, which proceed in the following order:


     Power Phase: Players distribute Power counters to each of the models in their team, usually up to the character’s Power value. If a character is KO, Power counters are instead generated.
     Initiative Phase: Players determine the order in which they will proceed through the round. This stage adds a level of unpredictability to the game – you might go first this round, but end up going last in the next.
     Action Phase: The players activate each character in turn – moving, fighting, shooting, and resolving special actions. Play alternates, with the player who went first activating a single model, then the second player activates a model, and so on, until all models that can act have done so.
     Final Phase: Some special effects must also be resolved in this phase. This is also a ‘tidying up’ phase, where Power counters are removed and scenario victory conditions are checked. If, at the end of the Final Phase, one player’s entire crew is Knocked Out and/or has been removed from play, the game ends and the other player is declared the victor.


Every test/combat (To Hit, Agility etc.) is resolved by rolling dice, usually 2d8.

Name: LOSS! in Space
Description:
This is simple competitive sci-fi game for 1-4 players. You're trying to escape your home planet and get to a new planet. It's a fast paced game, where the tables can turn any minute. You can help or sabotage another player, outfit your ship with the best ship parts you can, enhance the performance your shield or weapons or engine with performance enhancers. Play with the included events expansion to add some variety to your game.

The solar system is dying. The twin suns are imploding and the resulting vacuum is sucking all planets towards them which will eradicate all life. There are four inhabited planets in your solar system, all at odds with one another. Thankfully you found a habitable planet 14 parsecs away that will allow your race to thrive once more. Unfortunately, the rest of the planets in the solar system have discovered this new home world as well. This new world will only allow one race to live there in peace. It’s your duty with your intrepid crew to bring several hundred pioneers, frozen in stasis, to this new home world to restart your civilization. It’s the ultimate race with only one surviving species.

—description from the designer

Name: Aristeia!: Human Fate
Description:
The Human Fate (HF) expansion will increase the amount of options and interactions in your games with four new characters, each one of them with a brand new style of play and remarkable skills that will amaze all players.

Four aristos arrive to fiercely dispute the throne in the HexaDome. A rich heiress thirsty for blood, a high-performance athlete, an enigmatic competitor, and a national icon that has come to rewrite the history of Aristeia!

Dart is a natural adventurer, always seeking exciting challenges. She won’t hesitate to risk her own life just to feel another adrenaline rush. She is willing to use all the fortune of her family business, Aura Biochemicals, to become the Bahadur of this season.

Prysm has worked very hard to be where she is now. She is an innate athlete and competition is part of her DNA. Her whole life has been dedicated to improving every cell in her body based on a rigorous and tenacious training. Under the sponsorship of the mega company Ypsilon, her physical prowess will be put to the test in the HexaDome. She won’t give up, and she will fight to the end for the title of Bahadur.

Little or nothing is known about the girl behind Eclypse, the mysterious candidate of Baily Corp., who comes to relive the most glorious past of Aristeia! Her appearance has dismayed the public and has divided the media. She’s willing to kill anyone who crosses her path.

Bìxié is the national champion of Yu Jing, a great symbol and icon of a nation. All the propaganda and financial machinery of the Eastern state is at the service of the company Dágang. She aims to demonstrate her superiority to the entire Human Sphere and, above all, to their rival power, PanOceania. This mix of tradition and technology will leave the audience speechless when they see Bìxié in action.

With this new expansion, two new states are added to the game:

Marked: The Character that suffers this State can be chosen as Objective even without Line of Sight.
    Hidden. No Line of Sight can be drawn to the Model affected by this State, except by Range 1-1.

One of the existing rules of the game is also updated:

Poisoned. Poisoned state tokens are removed immediately after resolving their effect by showing their blue face.

—description from the publisher

Name: FootClub Ligue
Description:
Don't let anyone else lift the cup!

FootClub is a card game with a tactical dimension in which you control everything: recruitment during the transfer window, team lineup, pre-match strategy and coaching during the game.

Footclub offers a total immersion into the football experience, including the thrill and emotions of a real football match!

FootClub Ligue is a standalone extension of FootClub, which has the particularity of containing more components than the base box.

Stand alone: the box contains a complete set for 2 players, with 2 game modes available. Pee Wee mode (15 min): simple, accessible for all, perfect to discover the game, it will easily attract beginners as well as young players. Expert mode (60 min): strategically rich and with great replay value, it will satisfy experienced players.

Extension: by combining with the FootClub box, discover the League mode for 4 players. This is how FootClub reveals its true dimension.
Manage your recruitment budget in a "tight" transfer window, based on auctions.

Receive transfer offers. Will you withdraw a player despite a great offer?

Focus on your training centre: a young player can progress in a dazzling way to become a superstar!

Do you prefer short game sessions? It's simple and quick with the backup form.

Many new features and optional rules: new Match cards, new player positions, strengths of the goalkeepers, match on neutral ground.
Official rule of the Solo mode available for free download.

—description from the designer

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Midterm Pack 2018
Description: All-new Midterm Pack with 18 cards about the surreal fever dream that is American politics in 2018. All profits will be donated to Run for Something.

Name: The Mind: Level 13
Description: The Mind: Level 13 is a single card expansion for The Mind, one that allows you to achieve "Transzendentales Über-Ich", that is, transcendental superego, should you be able to complete a round of the game after everyone starts with thirteen cards in hand. Now you can make The Mind last a little bit longer — assuming you even make it to that stage in the first place.

Name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Infants Expansion
Description:
These aliens are the most basic of all xenomorph hive creatures, similar to a worker bee. Also referred to as Drones, they are responsible for the construction of alien hives by using a strong resin-like material they secrete. Spawned from human hosts, they stand roughly seven feet tall and sport smooth, elongated heads. As they age and mature, the smooth carapace sloughs off, revealing the ridged structures that adult Warriors have. Another job the Drones have is to procure captives for the hive to birth more xenomorphs. In combat, they are able to wield their long tails with deadly accuracy, the bladed tips able to punch through marine combat armour.

Like several other evolutions, they too are able to spit acid at their enemies and can do so with great ability. They also have enormous strength and they are able to easily subdue an adult human, or even fight a yautja head on. Drones often work alone, using stealth and waiting in ambushes to attack their prey. Their jet-black exo-skeleton allows them to blend into their environments; curiously well among the pipes and shrouded alcoves of starships. When they work together, a pack of them will often force their quarry directly into an ambush by chasing it around. Fear makes for a wonderful weapon.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cow's Look
Description:
Το ΒλÎ­μμα Της ΑγελÎ¬δας ("Cow's Look") is a game for 2 or more players played with a standard set of playing cards and three special dice. Each player rolls the dice and selects his actions aiming to be the first one to get rid of all his cards.

Each round ends as soon as one player discards his last card and then all other players score their hands. When someone reaches 150 points the game is over and the player with the least amount of points wins.

Name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Predators Expansion
Description:
Predators, also known as yautja, are an alien race that is best known for their hunting of the most dangerous prey in the galaxy, including humans and xenomorphs. These Hunts, as they are known, are done for honor, sport, and as a rite of passage for young Predators looking to become adults in their own right.

They are a sentient race that is humanoid in appearance, but larger than most actual humans in size, standing well  over  seven  feet  tall  and  weighing  300  lbs  or  more  in  many  cases.  They  breathe  an  atmosphere  that  is  similar to Earth’s, though with a higher degree of nitrogen. Their faces have been seen to have quill-like hair on their brows, cheeks, and chins. Their mouths have four mandibles they use to help communicate or to show emotion,  several  sharp  teeth  used  to  tear  flesh,  and  a  small,  thin,  snake-like  tongue.  Their  elongated  heads  have a crown of thick bone and end in a mass of long appendages that have been nicknamed dreadlocks.

As  with  humans,  their  skin  color  can  vary  from  light  to  dark  hues,  as  well  as  striped  and  mottled  patterns.
While  primitive  and  tribal  in  appearance,  their  technology  is  extremely  advanced.  Their  armor  and  weapons  
are made from an alloy that is resistant to even the corrosive effects of a xenomorphs acid blood. Most of them 
mount a plasma caster on their shoulder; a powerful energy cannon able to kill most of their enemies in a single 
shot that utilizes a high-tech, triple targeting laser to track their foes. Other weapons include combi-sticks, which are collapsible spears, and smart-disks that can eliminate multiple enemies in a single throw.

On their left arm, each yautja wears a wrist-gauntlet which allows them to access many different systems. It controls their cloaking ability, access and remote piloting control of their ships, local terrain layouts, and even contains  a  miniature  nuclear  explosive  to  ensure  that  their  technology  doesn’t  fall  into  their  enemy’s  hands.  
Some more evolved Predators even incorporate a second set of wrist-blades or even more weaponry packed into them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #14 – Israel #1
Description:
The Israel #1 expansion adds Israel national forces to the game. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     10 Player Soldiers 
     7 Non-Player Soldiers 
     9 Squad Soldiers 
     20 Weapons 
     5 Equipment
     5 Skills


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #15 – Israel #2
Description:
The Israel #2 expansion adds Israel national forces to the game. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     10 Player Soldiers 
     7 Non-Player Soldiers 
     8 Squad Soldiers 
     23 Weapons 
     1 Equipment
     1 Skill
     2 Events
     4 Locations


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #16 – Germany
Description:
The Germany expansion adds German national forces to the game. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     10 Player Soldiers 
     7 Non-Player Soldiers 
     9 Squad Soldiers 
     21 Weapons 
     4 Equipment
     5 Skills


—description from the publisher

Name: Le Dernier Casse
Description:
In Le Dernier Casse, you're trying to crack into opponents' safes and steal their ingots before they can get into yours.

Each player starts the game with three safes (i.e. three screens), a number of gold ingots that they secretly distribute within their safes, and three secret code numbers on cards. They look at the numbers, then place one under each safe to represent its combination.

At the start of the round, the active player reveals one more number card than the number of players. Each player in turn gives one of these cards to their left or right neighbor. The person receiving the card places it to the right of all their safes if the number on the card matches one of their combinations; otherwise this player places the card in front of one of their safes if the card is higher than that safe's combination and behind the safe if it's lower.

After everyone has finished the first phase, each player can attempt to guess the value of an opponent's combination. They must ante some gold, then identify a safe and a number. If they're wrong, the owner of the safe keeps their ante; if they're right, then the safe owner hands over all the gold in that safe to the active player. If all your safes have been cracked, you're out of the game!

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #17 – North Korean Adversaries
Description:
North Korean Adversaries adds the North Korea to the game. This is everything you need to take the war to a whole new enemy with your teams.

This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     27 Hostiles
     4 Events
     5 Missions
     5 Objectives
     3 Objective Hostiles
     12 Locations


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #18 – Nation Skills
Description:
Nation Skills adds skill cards and more for the current nations previously released in the Warfighter modern series. The previously released nations are the United States, United Kingdom and the Russian Federation.

This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     22 Player Soldiers (8 US, 7 UK, 7 Russia)
     12 Non-Player Soldiers (4 US, 4 UK, 4 Russia)
     8 Squad Soldiers (3 US, 3 UK, 2 Russia)
     11 Weapons (3 US, 3 UK, 5 Russia)
     3 Skills (1 US, 1 UK,1 Russia)


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #19 – Elite Drug War Adversaries
Description:
The South American drug war is back and bigger than ever. Elite Drug War Adversaries takes you back Central and South America. This Expansion gives you Hostile cards, Event cards, Location cards and new Soldier/NPS/Squad cards to use when you make a return to the jungle.

This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     5 Player Soldiers
     3 Non-Player Soldiers
     3 Squad Soldiers
     11 Weapons
     1 Equipment
     3 Skills
     23 Hostiles
     2 Events
     2 Missions 
     2 Objectives
     1 Objective Hostile


—description from the publisher

Name: Awkward Party
Description:
Game Intro. "Let’s face it. You don’t really want to be here. You don’t really want to talk to any of these people. You don’t really even want to play this game. But you came here for a reason, and you’re not going to get it unless you’re prepared to engage in a little small talk, the occasional social lubricant, and some generous nodding and smiling. If you play your cards right—literally in this case—you might just walk out of here a new person... yeah, who are we kidding, you’ll just be happy if you get through the evening with your dignity intact."

Awkward Party is a thematic card game, with party game elements, that pokes fun at the bizarre traditions and anxieties that define awkward social gatherings. At the start of the game, each player receives a hand of seven Awkward Party cards (hand limit 7), three Why Am I Even Here? Cards (hand limit), and sets their individual Awkwardness meter to 5. The Party Interest meter is put in the middle of the table and also set to 5. The Awkward Party cards are the main cards that the players play throughout the game with varying effects. They come in a number of categories such as Conversation, Venue, Money, Role, Drink, Support, Romantic Encounter, Rejection, and Something Interesting. The Conversation cards also have their own subjects such as Weather, Movies, Sports, Religion, Politics, and Sex.

The Why Am I Even Here? cards are the secret objectives each player is trying to complete. They also vary considerably from having a Conversation with all other players to receiving Money from two other players to acquiring the "Someone's Dog" card. Once one of their objectives has been completed, the player must reveal the corresponding Why Am I Even Here? card. In most cases, the winner of the game is the player who has revealed the most Why Am I Even Here? cards. There are a few exceptions such as the "Go Home" and the "Street Cred" Why Am I Even Here? cards, which are only completed and revealed when a particular game-ending event is triggered, even if it is not on the player's turn. If the event is triggered, the player holding the corresponding Why Am I Even Here? card wins the game regardless of how many revealed Why Am I Even Here? cards other players have. The game ends immediately when any one of the following events occurs:

     A player reveals three completed Why Am I Even Here? cards. 
     A player's Awkwardness meter exceeds 10 (and they are forced to leave the party).
     Party Interest drops below 1.
     Party Interest exceeds 10 for the third time and the cops arrive to shut it down.


Game-play itself is turn-based. Each player turn has four phases: 

     Play 0-2 Awkward Party cards. 
     Discard any number of Awkward Party and/or unrevealed Why Am I Even Here? cards. 
     Draw Awkward Party and/or Why Am I Even Here? cards up to the hand limit (revealed Why Am I Even Here? cards still count).
     Reduce Party Interest by 1.


If a player plays a conversation card on another player, any player may play another card to join the conversation if their awkwardness is low enough and they have a matching subject. With the exception of Conversation, Rejection, Money, and Support cards, turns can be stolen by other players by playing a card in the same category as the card just played. This card counts as the first card played by the player that just stole the turn. Turn-stealing can be chained, one card at a time, so long as players continue playing cards from the same category.

—description from the designer

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #22 – US Airborne
Description:
This expansion gives you the Soldiers, Weapons, Skills, and Gear to deploy United States Airborne soldiers. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     8 Player Soldiers    
     8 Non-Player Soldiers
     7 Squad Soldiers 
     5 Landing Zone
     9 Enemy Lines
     6 Equipment
     2 Weapons 
     4 Skills
     5 Airborne Missions
     2 Objectives


—description from the publisher

Name: Shard Slingers
Description:
Shard Slingers is a fast-paced, push your luck, card and dice game about a handful of sorcerers competing to cast the biggest and best spells they can, in order to amaze an arena of spectators. 
Players use 8-sided elemental dice, called Shards, to match up to similar elemental requirement icons on the spell cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Outlive: Underwater
Description:
2084: It has been five years now that the clans struggle to survive in their underground shelters. Lately, strange robots have been spotted near the river. The brave Conrad Bordage started an investigation to discover their provenance. What a surprise! They are controlled by a group of scientists living in a submarine base, and no one knew this all the time!

The Outlive: Underwater expansion introduces a new location: the Submarine Base. By going there, you can perform new actions, such as building a robot, raising the radioactivity in your opponents' shelters, or recruiting scientists. It also includes a new leader, new events and a new room for your shelter. Forget everything you know about Outlive, and rethink your strategies if you want to guide your clan to the victory!

This expansion also includes a solo mode to play Outlive alone — in case all your friends succumbed to the radioactivity!

—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #24 – Chinese Adversaries
Description:
This expansion gives you the Soldiers, Weapons, Skills, and Gear to combat Chinese Adversaries! This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     26 Hostiles
     3 Events
     5 Missions
     5 Objectives
     5 Objective Hostiles
     12 Locations


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #27 – Poland
Description:
The Poland expansion gives you Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from Poland. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


    10 Player Soldiers    
     7 Non-Player Soldiers
     8 Squad Soldiers 
     21 Weapons 
     5 Equipment
     5 Skills


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #28 – Australia
Description:
The Australian expansion gives you Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from Australia. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


    10 Player Soldiers    
     7 Non-Player Soldiers
     8 Squad Soldiers 
     25 Weapons 
     1 Equipment
     5 Skills


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #30 – Canada #1
Description:
The Canada #1 expansion gives you Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from Canada. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     8 Player Soldiers    
     6 Non-Player Soldiers
     6 Squad Soldiers 
     14 Weapons 
     6 Equipment
     9 Skills
     7 Actions


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #31 – Canada #2
Description:
The Canada #2 expansion gives you more Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from Canada. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     7 Player Soldiers    
     5 Non-Player Soldiers
     5 Squad Soldiers 
     15 Weapons 
     4 Equipment
     10 Skills
     9 Actions
     1 Location Marker


—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #32 – African Warlords #1
Description:
The African Warlords #1 expansion adds conflicts in Africa to the game. This expansion gives you Hostile cards, Event cards, and Location cards for engaging with African Warlords. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     25 Hostiles
     3 Events
     5 Missions
     5 Objectives
     2 Objective Hostiles
     12 Locations
     3 Eqiupment
     1 Skill


—description from publisher

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #33 – African Warlords #2
Description:
The African Warlords #2 expansion adds conflicts in Africa to the game. This expansion gives you Hostile cards, Event cards, and Location cards for engaging with African Warlords. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     25 Hostiles
     4 Events
     5 Missions
     5 Objectives
     2 Objective Hostiles
     12 Locations
     2 Eqiupment
     1 Skill


—description from the publisher

Name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Promo Card Detective Wolverine Heroic Bystander
Description:
Some of the first prints of the Marvel Legendary expansions come with a single extra bonus card. The Detective Wolverine bystander promo card comes in the first prints of the Noir expansion.

Detective Wolverine
Bystander
When you rescue this bystander, Investigate the Villain Deck for a Villain worth 1 Victory Point and put in into your Victory Pile

Promo Code: LPC 33

Name: Warfighter: Expansion #37 – K9 & Handlers
Description:
The military working dogs are ready for action!

The K9 expansion brings a different soldier type to your team. When you bring a K9 unit on a mission you will draw an event card when you place a location card, before drawing for hostiles. These events will range from, bombs, intimidation, rescue, takedown or threat classification. Each K9 has varying stats to check against when rolling to resolve these events. There are plenty of skills and equipment K9 units can be equipped with to gain bonuses against the threats.

This expansion offers 80 cards including:


     9 Player Soldier Handlers (4 US, 1 Israel, 1 Australia, 1 UK, 1 Russian, 1 Poland)
     9 Squad K9 Soldiers (4 US, 1 Israel, 1 Australia, 1 UK, 1 Russian, 1 Poland)
     18 Weapons (4 Israel, 4 Australia, 3 UK, 3 Russian, 4 Poland)
     6 Equipment
     11 Skills (3 Human, 8 K9)
     21 K9 Encounters
     6 K9 Objectives


—description from the publisher

Name: Z for Zombie
Description:
Zombies break out in Hong Kong!!! It is an impossible mission to fight with too many zombies. To survive, you need to get the food outside and back home quickly.

Z for Zombie is a party game based on a Hong Kong novel, which also has comics published about it. In the game, you take role of a character in the comics and they need to get food from outside for their family and buddies. Player will get the same set of five cards as their hand with different actions: alert, move or search. Players play their own action card together to move towards END and get food on the road. Zombie will move once after three players’ actions and they will get faster and faster. Player who got enough food can get onto the Mobile Smoothie, or you need to go to the END by run.

The food token can be flipped as you wish when you get it. It may become 2 points or 3 point, but may also alert the zombies moving forward. If the token was not flipped, it also gets 1 point. Games end when all the players have arrived at END or have been eaten by zombies. The surviving player with highest point wins the game.

Name: BunneeBank
Description:
BunneeBank is a 3-4 player fantasy board game that aims to teach your kids about the ups & downs of banking and finance while exploring the rich and vibrant planet of Heeleet; where magic and laughter are one and the same. The road to success is paved with profits and losses, investments and loans, surprises, adventures and...Bunnees!

You and your fellow Bunnee Bankers must race to the top of Bunnee Money Pile by acquiring 5000 Golden Carrots without accumulating any debt.

It's time to teach kids to respect their parents money, who better to teach them than cute bunnies?

—description from the designer

Name: Siege of the Citadel: Dark Apostles Expansion
Description:
Expand your Siege of the Citadel game with an encounter with one of the five Dark Apostles: Ilian, Algeroth, Demnogonis, Muawijhe or Semai.

Power Cards define the Apostles' abilities and stats; and the Doomtroopers must deplete the Power Card deck to be able to defeat the Apostle.

Name: Kharnage: Cohen Jr.
Description:
Single card, Kickstarter Exclusive, micro expansion.

4+ players


    During the set up, set Cohen Junior near the Domination token.
    During the Domination token distribution, the 4th player who destroyed the most cards takes Cohen Junior and deploy him in his Army for the next round, even if Cohen Junior is already in the Army of another player.
    When Cohen Junior is destroyed, the card is not kept by the player who destroyed him. The card is set again near the Domination tokens.
    When Cohen Junior is alone in the Army of a player, you don’t earn a Kharnage token when you destroy him.


Interaction between Cohen and Cthulhu:
Cohen is given to the 4th player and the 5th player draws the first card of the Horror pile. You must be 5 players to play with Cohen Junior and Cthulhu expansions.

Name: Kharnage: It's So Big!
Description:
An expansion containing six big monsters for Kharnage.

1 Set of six dual card monsters. 
4 Game aids.
1 Punchboard with tokens.

Name: Spot 'em Fast
Description:
Many teeny-weeny meemeecs! They're a fun bunch, and they like to play tricks and mess about. Even more than that, they like to play hide-and-seek and make silly poses.

In Spot 'em Fast, players roll the dice and find the matching meemeec. Hurry! Found it? Then copy their pose. If you are the first to do so, take a token. The first player to collect five tokens wins.

Name: Das verdrehte Labyrinth: Happy Meal Edition
Description: Das verdrehte Labyrinth - Happy Meal Edition is a miniature version of the original Das verdrehte Labyrinth. This game was distributed as part of the McDondald's Happy Meals Menu.

Name: Wishes and Dreams
Description: In Libertex Ð”ÐµÑ‚ÑÐºÐ¸Ð¹ (Wishes and Dreams), each young player has a dream, and in order to fulfill it they need to collect money. Players earn money by means of their businesses, starting new courses and managing their assets in every possible way. The advanced version of the rules contains basic principles of working with shares. The first player to collect enough money to achieve their dream wins.

Name: Who's There?
Description:
To set up ÐšÑ‚Ð¾ Ñ‚Ð°Ð¼? (Who's There?), place the colored animal figurines on the table, then cover them with the houses so that young players won't see where each animal hides.

One child takes a card with a picture of an animal on it and tries to guess where that animal hides. After several turns, they need to remember four or five different animals at once, which can be a tough challenge when you're only a toddler...

Name: UnderWorld: The Card Game
Description:
Only a small number of people know the truth of the world. The people who have Super-Powers formed into 8 different factions and control the world surreptitiously. These people now come together for a same purpose: taking over the whole world and dominating all the factions.

UnderWorld is a card game that designed for two players. With the expansion packs, it will support up to 4 players and unlock 2V2 gaming mode. To begin the battle, each player needs to draw 5 cards from two of the factions first and utilize these cards to fulfill the winning conditions.

Both side of the players need to fight for several objectives such as obtaining highest points and holding the most district cards through sending out character cards with strategies to beat the opponents. Through expanding influences on those districts or beating opponents’ characters, the corresponding points will be gained. The first player who receives 8 points will win the game.

Name: Selfie Cards
Description:
Every card in Selfie Cards has one real-life achievement that will make your life more fun if you try to achieve it. To play, take two or three cards a week and try to take selfies as specified on them. If you are unable to do it, take another card and put the one you cannot do under the deck.

Compare your results to the list of achievements to see how you stack up!

Name: Conversation
Description:
At last, you find yourself in company with the person you want to know everything about. Are you thinking about the right way to start the conversation? And, maybe, they're thinking the same? Put your doubts aside, grab this box, and prove that they are a great person.

Conversation contains 149 questions that you will definitely want to answer, whether playing with only one other person or up to five. Take one of these cards, ask a question, then decide who is worth your attention and who is not as interesting as they appeared at first sight. Whoever collects the most votes at the end of the game wins!

Name: Courage
Description:
Courage is a 2-4 player battle royal style conquering game. You are a want-to-be hero and have awoken on the island of courage, a place to prove yourself but seems like your not the only one. You and you're friends build the island and use its various unique movement mechanics to approach and attack each others castles, use  the moving terrain and items to get there quickly and effectively.
once you take an opponents castle they work for you, meaning this game starts as a competitive game but ends co-operative.  
Last castle standing, wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Island of Gems
Description:
In Island of Gems, you are decorating the beaches of the Gem Islands to entice visiting tourists. Enlist in the help of magical seahorses that give you extra victory points and encounter scuba divers that allow you to alter the board.

Fight the incoming tide every three turns while you alternate moves in this highly strategic duel game. Sometimes the tide carries in diamonds, requiring you to decide when and where to focus the most attention. Earn the most seashells and win the favor of the inhabitants of the Gem Islands!

Your turn is simple. You will place one of your gems on an open space of one of the islands available. The island you are sent to depends on where the previous gem was placed. Picture each island as a representation of the whole 3x3 board. Whichever of the nine spaces are chosen is the island that the next gem must be placed. For instance, the blue gem is placed on the middle right space of the island. This means that the next gem will be played on the middle right island. This will continue until all 27 gems have been placed.

Battle it out with your rival islander to complete patterns, control each of the islands and recruit seahorses.

Every game is different! With 14 islands to choose from, no two games will ever be the same. Seahorse cards score in two different ways from the orientation of the player, meaning any one card has different value for both players!

Tide cards dictate the flow of the game, either flooding an island or revealing diamonds that can lead to victory.

—description from the designer


        Cardboard Edison Runner-Up 2022
        LUCI Award Finalist 2022
        Board Game Design Lab Challenge Runner-Up 2019
        Note: This game is completely changed from its 2019 iteration.  While using some mechanics from the old version, Island of Gems in its current state has been adapted for 2 players with fundamental scoring changes and differences in components, component count and presentation.  For the purpose of BGG, this is still considered related to its old version but the similarities are very minimal.  The videos on the BGG page reflect its old iteration and not the new one.  This is a complete rehaul.  The game was an attempted KS that I cancelled and no copies of this game have been sold as this game is still looking for a publisher.

Name: Finca
Description:
The players take the roles of Mallorcan farmers, who strive to harvest as many of the island‘s tropical fruits: ï¬gs, almonds, olives, oranges, grapes, and lemons, as possible. The players deliver their harvested fruits to the island communities, which have constantly changing requirements during the course of the game. For these deliveries, the players receive victory points. In the end, the player with the most victory points is the winner.

Note: Finca: El Razul is included in the box with versions listed under this entry.
